image.altText: A young woman cries with her arm around another person, behind police tape

props.synopsis: Fifteen people have died, including a 10-year-old girl, after a terror attack on a Jewish festival at Sydney's Bondi Beach. One of two alleged gunmen has also died, while a further 42 people were taken to hospital. Follow live.

title.children: 15 dead in Bondi terror attack

image.altText: Kendrick holds hit hat and microphone, looking down standing on stage.

props.synopsis: American rap superstar Kendrick Lamar brought the house down at Spilt Milk in Canberra, but it was his interaction with a nine-year-old superfan that stole the show.

title.children: 'We were just crying': Kendrick Lamar serenades 9yo at Spilt Milk

image.altText: A woman wearing a black jacket and green top.

props.synopsis: After 24 years of Labor government, First Nations people in Australia's capital are frustrated and exhausted by a lack of meaningful progress to close the gap.

title.children: 'We are born into that fear': Canberra's failure to fix systemic racism

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe is sentenced to 30 years' jail for stabbing his Canberra zoo colleague Tshewang Choden to death in the storeroom of the kitchen area where they both worked.

title.children: Man jailed for murdering co-worker 'because he couldn't have her'

image.altText: An aerial view of a suburb with standalone houses.

props.synopsis: It's called the 'bush capital', but three quarters of Canberra's suburbs have recorded a decline in tree coverage.

title.children: Three quarters of the 'bush capital' sees decline in tree coverage

image.altText: A watch, ring, bracelet, police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege the men travelled to Australia to rob a Canberra home, stealing distinctive, luxury items.

title.children: Four French men came to Canberra for a $10m heist, police say

image.altText: A man in a yellow puffer jacket, walking with his hands in his pockets and his head down.

props.synopsis: A judge says the former art shop worker had a "complete disconnect between perception and reality" as she jails him for rape.

title.children: Man jailed for 'orchestrated' rape of customer in shop where he worked

image.altText: Costumes worn in Netflix's Squid Game on display in a museum.

props.synopsis: Whether it's KPop Demon Hunters, Squid Game, or Gangnam Style, Korean pop culture has made its mark in Australia — and the National Museum of Australia's new exhibition explores just that.

title.children: Exhibit explores Korean culture from Gangnam Style to KPop Demon Hunters

image.altText: Dolphin Sands bushfire emergency,

props.synopsis: A bushfire in Tasmania that destroyed 19 homes was caused by a registered burn conducted about a week earlier, which was not extinguished by a landowner, authorities have confirmed.

title.children: Bushfire catastrophe caused by burn-off not extinguished properly

image.altText: The old bank at the township of Snowtown.

props.synopsis: Snowtown serial killer James Vlassakis will remain behind bars, after the South Australian Parole Board's decision to release him was overturned.

title.children: Snowtown murderer James Vlassakis to remain behind bars

image.altText: William Johns is an insurance claims advocate and founder of Claim Right.  He sits in his Sydney office in a navy blue suit.

props.synopsis: The regulator has found that while some superannuation funds have improved insurance claims response times, others are still falling short, with long delays in relation to mental health claims.

title.children: Super funds accused of delaying insurance claims

image.altText: Celine Cremer smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: One of the key searchers involved in the renewed hunt for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer has told of the emotion and excitement when her mobile phone was found, two and a half years after she disappeared in Tasmania.

title.children: Searcher tells of 'emotion, excitement' when Celine Cremer's phone found

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis plantations

props.synopsis: There doesn't seem to be much political mileage for the government to do anything at all — whether that is cracking down and forcing cannabis users back onto the black market or fully legalising the substance.

title.children: Australia's medicinal cannabis situation is unattractive for politicians

image.altText: A grey-haired man stands wiith his arms crossed at a residential contruction site.

props.synopsis: Police say a warrant has been issued for the man's arrest in relation to the matter.

title.children: Gold Coast builder gobsmacked as alleged scammer claims to be his nephew

image.altText: Office-worker watches share prices at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: Shares in stock exchange operator ASX fall as the regulator increases its capital requirements after damning inquiry findings. The local share market opens its last full trading week of the year in the red. Follow live.

title.children: Australian market falls, ASX Limited shares slide on ASIC hit

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: China's industrial and retail sectors slow further, construction spending shrinks
Blue chips suffering the blues, down 0.7%

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue lab clothing look at a brain scan on a computer.

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest brain research centre is suing one of its executives, alleging he deleted troves of commercially sensitive information during a midnight incursion at its Melbourne laboratory.

title.children: Brain research centre sues executive, alleging he stole and erased files

image.altText: A water truck pumping water at Quinninup townsite.

props.synopsis: Quinninup and Northcliffe in Western Australia's south west receive an average of 1 metre of rain every year, so why has the state government spent millions of dollars trucking in drinking water?

title.children: The state government has trucked water to WA's wettest towns for 15 years

image.altText: Soren Copley, a heavily bearded middle-aged man.

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police says it launched an investigation into North Queensland man Soren Copley in September after a tip-off from US Homeland Security.

title.children: North Queensland man in court over Philippines child sex abuse allegations

image.altText: A man in a mechanic workshop holding an axe, with cars being repaired behind him

props.synopsis: Kahu Woolley was clinically dead multiple times, but quick actions by his friends brought him back.

title.children: Axeman brought back to life after mid-competition heart attack

image.altText: A young woman with red hair a white striped top and overalls looks off to the side of the screen, video game screenshot

props.synopsis: There are games to suit everyone, and overwhelmingly Australians are a game-playing nation. Here are some of the most important titles released this year.

title.children: The 10 best video games that kept us glued to our screens in 2025

image.altText: 2025-11-17T125307Z_741427822_RC2CYHAFXUU6_RTRMADP_3_UKRAINE-CRISIS-FRANCE-MACRON

props.synopsis: Ukraine relinquishes its plan to join the NATO military alliance in exchange for Western security guarantees as it seeks an end to the war with Russia.

title.children: Ukraine drops ambition to join NATO ahead of peace talks

image.altText: GettyImages-2251349400

props.synopsis: Matildas gun Sam Kerr starts on the bench again, but makes an immediate impact for Chelsea in a 3-0 WSL victory.

title.children: Kerr starts as sub again before starring for Chelsea in WSL victory

image.altText: Harold Holt spearfishing off the Great Barrier Reef in 1967.

props.synopsis: Do you have the answers for our This Week in History quiz?

title.children: History quiz: The first Simpsons episode, a missing PM and a new puzzle

image.altText: GettyImages-2251821666

props.synopsis: With England pinning its hopes on victory in the third Test, the tourists have been warned that the Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks.

title.children: Data shows Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks for England

image.altText: A photo of stormclouds above a city

props.synopsis: Parts of south-east Queensland can expect a slight easing of summer heat early this week, with the Bureau of Meteorology forecasting a 6C drop in some areas.

title.children: Dreary weather to take sting out of south-east Queensland heat

image.altText: sdgfdgh

props.synopsis: Patrick Mahomes tears his ACL, the Packers suffer a major blow, Donald Trump's coin toss goes viral and Old Man Rivers scores a touchdown. Here's the five quick hits from the NFL action.

title.children: Five quick hits: Grandpa throws a touchdown, as Chiefs star tears his ACL

image.altText: A large modern-looking building stands three storeys above the street

props.synopsis: A Victorian tribunal will investigate whether Mallee Family Care and Mildura Rural City Council could have breached planning permit rules.

title.children: Parking spat involving new Mildura family care centre heads to VCAT

image.altText: A cricketer in bright orange plays a sweep shot with white ball in view

props.synopsis: Cooper Connolly leads the Scorchers to victory as star Sixers recruit Babar Azam struggles in the BBL curtain raiser at Perth Stadium.

title.children: Connolly stars as Scorchers down Sixers in BBL opener

image.altText: Leila Jeffreys sits side on to the camera and holds her camera to her eye.

props.synopsis: Over the past four decades, the Australian Antarctic Arts Fellowship has given creatives the opportunity to travel south and develop works on the icy continent.

title.children: 'Magic happens in Antarctica': The creative program taking artists to the ice

image.altText: Michelle Rowland gives a press conference.

props.synopsis: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland is told to repay a portion of travel expenses she claimed for a 2023 family trip to Perth.

title.children: Attorney-general to repay family travel expenses

image.altText: A building with a sign on top saying "Karratha Airport".

props.synopsis: The City of Karratha has applied to the federal government for international airport status in a move that has been welcomed by residents.

title.children: Karratha residents hopeful as council bids for international airport

image.altText: A women in a black shirt and multi coloured hat, sits in the shade as the suns hit a table next to her.

props.synopsis: Data obtained by the ABC shows people are waiting months, if not years, for dental care in every Australian state and territory due to the cost.

title.children: 'It's cooked': Big Brother contestant quit so she could afford the dentist

image.altText: Yellow spray paint markings on a road in front of a suburban shopping strip.

props.synopsis: Police say a vehicle struck a group of pedestrians on Saturday night.

title.children: Driver charged with attempted murder after 'unbelievable' alleged hit-and-run

image.altText: A crowd at a Lionel Messi appearance.

props.synopsis: Indian football fans ripped up seats and invaded the pitch in Kolkata as Lionel Messi's first appearance in India took a chaotic and dangerous turn.

title.children: Chaos as Indian fans riot at Lionel Messi appearance
